newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA - SAVINGS BANK TO PAY 2.8 MLN LITAS DIVIDENDS.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA - SAVINGS BANK TO PAY 2.8 MLN LITAS DIVIDENDS.

text.p: Lithuania's huge state-run Savings Bank said on Friday that its general shareholders' meeting on Thursday decided to pay 2.8 million litas in dividends.
The bank on Tuesday announced that its 1996 net profit had soared to 30 million litas versus a loss of 39 million litas the previous year.
"The shareholders decided to use most of the 1996 profit to cover the losses of the previous year," Arunas Marcinkevicius, the bank's spokesman, told Reuters.
"One share with a face value of 100 litas will be paid seven litas in dividends," he added.
The shareholders also forecast a 1997 net profit of seven million litas.

The bank, the second largest in the country in terms of assets, has not been included in the government's privatisation programme though the cabinet has not ruled out the possibility of eventually selling it off.
The Lithuanian parliament on Thursday approved a law paving the way for the privatisation of the country's other two big state banks, the Agricultural Bank and the State Commercial Bank.
